title: How to Make a Sausage Casserole

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven to 300 degrees F or 150 degrees C.
Prepare the vegetables.
steps.description: Slice the leek and carrots into small chunks. Chop the rosemary, garlic cloves, and onion into fine pieces.

steps.headline: Heat an oiled frying pan.
steps.description: Fry the Cumberland sausages for about 8 minutes until they turn a golden brown color. Transfer the sausages to a casserole dish.

steps.headline: Fry the vegetables.
steps.description: Cook and fry the garlic, carrots, onions, and leaks until soft and tender. Transfer everything to the casserole dish.

steps.headline: Pour the wine into the frying pan to deglaze it.
steps.description: Pour the wine into the casserole dish.

steps.headline: Pour the beef stock, rosemary, and thyme into the casserole dish.
steps.description: Season with salt and pepper to taste. To thicken the liquid, add the 1 tablespoon of flour.

steps.headline: Place a lid on the casserole dish and bake in the oven for 1 hour.

text: Pre-heat the oven to 300 degrees F or 150 degrees C.  Prepare the vegetables. Slice the leek and carrots into small chunks. Chop the rosemary, garlic cloves, and onion into fine pieces. Heat an oiled frying pan. Fry the Cumberland sausages for about 8 minutes until they turn a golden brown color. Transfer the sausages to a casserole dish. Fry the vegetables. Cook and fry the garlic, carrots, onions, and leaks until soft and tender. Transfer everything to the casserole dish. Pour the wine into the frying pan to deglaze it. Pour the wine into the casserole dish. Pour the beef stock, rosemary, and thyme into the casserole dish. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To thicken the liquid, add the 1 tablespoon of flour. Place a lid on the casserole dish and bake in the oven for 1 hour.  Serve with mashed potatoes.
